intro: Biscutella valentina var. laevigata, commonly known as the smooth biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow, cruciform flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. This variety is distinguished by its smooth, glabrous leaves, which set it apart from other varieties within the species.
